The Class object takes care of simplifying (or create? :P) object oriented programming in Javascript, it takes parts from some languages like PHP and C#.

With the Class object you can create classes and inherit from them like you would do in other languages (sadly it's more Java-like).

When a method is overrided you can still access the parent's method by setting $super as first argument in a method, $super will be a reference to the parent's method function with the same name as the overrided method.
You'll understand better in the examples at the end.
